english.response:
The United Arab Emirates (UAE) is a federation of seven emirates, and it does not have a single prime minister. Instead, each emirate has its own ruler, known as an Emir or Sheikh.
The current rulers of the seven emirates are:
These rulers make up the Federal Supreme Council (FSC), which is the highest governing body in the UAE. However, there is no single prime minister who oversees the entire country.
لا يوجد رؤساء في الإمارات العربية المتحدة، حيث تعتمد البلاد على نظام الحكم الإمارة، حيث يعيش mỗi إمارة في herself ، ويشرف كل منهم على شؤونها.
ولكن، يتمتع каждى إمارة بمرشح للرئيس للحكم في كل إمارة .
The United Arab Emirates (UAE) was established on December 2, 1971. It was formed after seven emirates gained independence from the United Kingdom and united to form a single country.
Prior to that, the seven emirates were:
Each of these emirates had its own ruler (Emir) and was a separate entity. However, in 1968, the seven emirates signed an agreement to form a federation, which came into effect on December 2, 1971.
The UAE has since become one of the wealthiest countries in the world, thanks to its rich oil reserves and strategic location in the Middle East.

تأسست الإمارات العربية المتحدة في 2 ديسمبر 1971، عندما تم تشكيل السبع إمارة لتحتفظ بالمنشأ الحكومي والسياسي.
قبل ذلك، كانت كل من هذه الإمارات Separate دولة ، ولكنها سُمِح ​​بمراكز القمة وتم تشكيلها في عام 1968.
